str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Ten. A primary number; ten.
From a primary kar; a horn.
And, even, also, namely.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
And, even, also, namely.
Ten. A primary number; ten.
A head-wreath, crown, diadem. From a compound of dia and deo; a 'diadem'.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary kar; a horn.
And, even, also, namely.
Abusive or scurrilous language, blasphemy. From blasphemos; vilification.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
